title: James Croft (priest)

sentences.sentence: James Croft (2 July 1784  â€“ 9 May 1869) was Archdeacon of Canterbury from 18 June 1825 until his death
The son of Robert Croft, Canon of York, he was educated at Peterhouse, Cambridge
Croft was ordained in 1810 and held incumbencies at Ingoldmells, Saltwood, Great Chart and Cliffe-at-Hoo
This article about a Church of England archdeacon in the Province of Canterbury is a stub
You can help Wikipedia by expanding it

main_sentence_from_spike: The son of Robert Croft , Canon of York , he was educated at Peterhouse , Cambridge .
